alert.note: Alert for Pickens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 21 at 5:39AM EDT until June 24 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following county, Pickens. * WHEN...Until 645 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas and the tributaries of Lake Jocassee in Pickens County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 535 AM EDT, Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - At 530 AM EDT, the streamgauge at Twelve Mile Creek near Liberty, SC was at a stage of 5.7ft and continuing to rise rapidly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Easley, Clemson, Pickens, Central, Liberty, Norris, Six Mile, Keowee Toxaway State Park, Lake Keowee, Lake Hartwell, Nine Times, Sunset and Dacusville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
